Grow your own Black Beauty eggplant with Mr Fothergill's Seeds. Black Beauty Eggplant (Solanum melongena) is one of the very best varieties, not least because of its dark purple fruit-nearly black, hence the name-which has an outstanding earthy flavour.

Its texture is smooth and tender, too, so it can add smoothness to soups or stars all on its own when grilled or roasted. Black Beauty eggplant is perfect for Mediterranean recipes like rich and hearty moussaka or creamy baba ganoush. Winner of an RHS Award of Garden Merit for reliability and good performance.

title: Raspberry Chilliwack
description: Raspberries are a versatile fruit used to make mouthwatering jams, sauces, purees, soufflés or simply eaten fresh with cream or ice-cream. They are a suckering plant that grow best in cooler climates and prefer a rich well drained soil in a position that does not have exposure to the hot afternoon sun. When planting create a mound of 10-15cm to assist drainage, mulch and keep well watered during growing period. Attaining a height of 2m they should be supported with a trellis or grown up against a wall. Raspberries are produced on last season's canes which should be cut back to ground level eac

description: Vigorous growing variety with very sweet, low acid fruit. Grow in a raised bed or in pots. For best results the soil should be well prepared with organic matter and have good drainage. Surface mulching is recommended to retain moisture and limit weed growth. Strawberries are shallow rooted so require ample moisture to ensure good growth and fruit production. A liquid fertiliser should be applied throughout the growing season. Plants bear well for about three seasons before needing to be replaced.
